title: Nahan - a small town in Himachal Pradesh home to numerous legends and holy temples
text:
Nahan is a small hamlet located in the state of Himachal Pradesh, surrounded by lush greenery and majestic Himalayan peaks. It is a quiet town and a religious one with large number of temples scattered all over the region. Mother Nature has always been grateful to this place and there are numerous sightseeing spots. Visit the town for a relaxing vacation and pick a hotel from the long Nahan hotels list. 
Nestled on one of the hilltops of the magnificent Shivalik Hills in north India, Nahan is a small hamlet most noted for its greenery rich surroundings, religion dominated culture, and large number of Hindu temples. It is the headquarter of Sirmaur District in the state of Himachal Pradesh and is a quiet place. It is an old place, founded in early 1600s by Raja Karan Prakash. Like rest of the state, the place is highly religious and evidently, there are numerous religious legends and beliefs that circle within the region. In fact, there is a high probability that the name of the place is based on legends. It is believed that in the ancient times a saint used to live here with a companion named Nahar. Nahar signified “do not kill”, and there is a conception that the place took its name from an incident where a king tried to kill a lion and in order to protect the lion the sage said Nahar. 

The uncharted, lush, forest-covered regions and distinct pleasant climate make Nahan a perfect getaway to get rid of city blues while spending time in tranquility. There are some good luxury hotels in Nahan offering best staying experience and genuine hospitality of the state. The close proximity of the place to well-known cities in north India makes it easily accessible. Chandigarh Airport (about 90 k.m. away) is the nearest airport and the most ideal route to access the place if you are boarding a flight. Shimla Airport is also not too far from the town. Besides, there are a couple of train route options to pick from, they being Ambala, Barara, Kalka, and Chandigarh. 

Nahan is a small town with dust free environment, clean roads, and green fields. It is possible to access every corner of the town on foot and it is in fact the best way to explore and discover the place. Renuka lake, a naturally formed lake, is one of the most popular tourist place for jaunts here. It is about 38 k.m. from the town's centre and a perfect place to admire nature and enjoy boating. The lake is conceived as the personification of goddess Renuka, a revered local goddess, and counts amongst the largest lakes in the state. 

Churdhar Peak is a popular trekking destination. Situated at an altitude of about 3650 meters from the sea level, it is one of the most exciting treks passing through verdant forests and fields. Suketi Fossil Park is yet another chief tourist attraction here. It is a theme park and Asia's first of its kind of fossil park. Its location is 21 k.m. from the town, established on the site where many actual fossils were discovered. 
Apart from these there are several other amazing sightseeing spots nearby the town. Jaitak Fort, Rani Tal, Jagannath Temple (inspired from the original Jagannath temple in Puri), Simbalbara Wildlife Sanctuary, Renuka Wildlife Park, Sirmouri Tal, Jamu Peak. Chaugan Road, Nahan Bada Bazaar, and Mall Road are the name a few.
